oshi.util.platform.windows

Class PdhUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • oshi.util.platform.windows.PdhUtil

  • public class PdhUtil
extends Object
    Helper class to centralize the boilerplate portions of PDH counter setup and allow applications to easily add, query, and remove counters.
    Author:
    widdis[at]gmail[dot]com

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • isCounter

        public static boolean isCounter(String counterString)
        Report if a performance counter is being monitored
        Parameters:
        counterString - The counter to monitor
        Returns:
        True if the counter already exists

      • addCounter

        public static boolean addCounter(String counterString)
        Begin monitoring a Performance Data counter
        Parameters:
        counterString - The counter to monitor
        Returns:
        True if the counter has been successfully added or already exists

      • addCounter2DArray

        public static boolean addCounter2DArray(String name,
                                        String[][] counterStringArray)
        Begin monitoring a 2D array of Performance Data counters
        Parameters:
        name - A unique name that will always correspond to the same String array
        counterStringArray - A 2D array of string counter names to monitor
        Returns:
        True if the counters have been successfully added or already exist

      • removeCounter

        public static void removeCounter(String counterString)
        Stop monitoring a Performance Data counter
        Parameters:
        counterString - The counter to stop monitoring

      • queryCounter

        public static long queryCounter(String counterString)
        Query the raw counter value of a Performance Data counter. Further mathematical manipulation/conversion is left to the caller.
        Parameters:
        counterString - The counter to query
        Returns:
        The raw value of the counter

      • queryCounterTimestamp

        public static long queryCounterTimestamp(String counterString)
        Get the timestamp of a raw counter value of a Performance Data counter. Does not update the counter, and should normally be called after querying the counter.
        Parameters:
        counterString - The counter to query
        Returns:
        The raw value of the counter

      • queryCounter2DArray

        public static long[][] queryCounter2DArray(String name,
                                           String[][] counterStringArray)
        Query the raw counter value of an array of Performance Data counters. Further mathematical manipulation/conversion is left to the caller.
        Parameters:
        name - A unique name that will always correspond to the same String array
        counterStringArray - A 2D array of string counter names to monitor
        Returns:
        The raw values of the counters corresponding to the string
